arm_group.description: administration of 60 mg of methylprednisolone at 8:00 am and 100 ml of 0.9 % sodium chloride (placebo) at 6:00 pm
administration of 100 mg of ketoprofen at 8:00 am and at 6:00 pm
administration of 100 ml of 0.9%  sodium chloride (placebo) at 8:00 am and at 6:00 pm

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether anti-inflammatory drugs or glucocorticoids
      are effective in the treatment of acute sciatica

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory (NSAI)Drug and Glucocorticoids in Acute Sciatica
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory Drug and Glucocorticoids in Acute Sciatica

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: VAS is measured in millimiters (0 to 100). This pain score is recommended in rheumatologic units in France.
primary_outcome.measure: Mean visual analogue scale (VAS) for leg pain (radicular pain) in 3 groups

reference.citation: Roncoroni C, Baillet A, Durand M, Gaudin P, Juvin R. Efficacy and tolerance of systemic steroids in sciatica: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2011 Sep;50(9):1603-11. doi: 10.1093/rheumatology/ker151. Epub 2011 Apr 27. Review.

Chou R, Huffman LH; American Pain Society; American College of Physicians. Medications for acute and chronic low back pain: a review of the evidence for an American Pain Society/American College of Physicians clinical practice guideline. Ann Intern Med. 2007 Oct 2;147(7):505-14. Review. Erratum in: Ann Intern Med. 2008 Feb 5;148(3):247-8.
Vroomen PC, de Krom MC, Slofstra PD, Knottnerus JA. Conservative treatment of sciatica: a systematic review. J Spinal Disord. 2000 Dec;13(6):463-9.

Koes BW, Scholten RJ, Mens JM, Bouter LM. Efficacy of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs for low back pain: a systematic review of randomised clinical trials. Ann Rheum Dis. 1997 Apr;56(4):214-23. Review.

Luijsterburg PA, Verhagen AP, Ostelo RW, van Os TA, Peul WC, Koes BW. Effectiveness of conservative treatments for the lumbosacral radicular syndrome: a systematic review. Eur Spine J. 2007 Jul;16(7):881-99. Epub 2007 Apr 6. Review.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: VAS is measured in millimeters (0 to 100).
secondary_outcome.measure: Mean visual analogue scale (VAS) for back pain in 3 groups

secondary_outcome.description: Drug compliance is estimated based on the proportion of the treatment actually administered.
The EIFEL questionnaire is the translation of the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire (RMDQ) and has been validated in acute low back pain.
secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of treatment on the EIFEL Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, 1 and 3 months after intervention

secondary_outcome.description: Lasegue's sign is the lumbar pain experienced by the patient on passive movement of the legs during flexion of hip joint i.e. passive straight leg raising. It is assessed as either 'Positive' or 'Negative' sign.
secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Lasegue's sign compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, Day 1,2,3,4 and 5 of study period

secondary_outcome.description: Schober's test is a test used in rheumatology to measure the ability of  patient to flex their lower back
Analgesic consumption between active treatment group and placebo group was registered and differences between groups were calculated and presented as percentual differences.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, day 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and day 5, 1 and 3 months

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patient having surgery and/or lumbar epidural injection during study period
Number of adverse events and/or high blood pressure between intervention group.
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical tolerance: adverse events and/or high blood pressure

secondary_outcome.description: measures of leukocytes, erythrocytes, hemoglobin, platelets, serum sodium, potassium, glucose, plasma creatinine between intervention group
monitoring of glycemic status is measured for each day of treatment
To assess the cost of sciatica for society
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days of hospitalisation sick leave, number of days lost to illness

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
